NOTICE_DATA.ORIGINAL_CPV: Medical equipments, pharmaceuticals and personal care products

CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03B15

SHORT_DESCR.P: Asker and Hurum municipalities intends to enter into a framework agreement for up to four years (2 years + 1 year + 1 year) for up to 100 electronic medicine dispensers. After a 2 years period, the municipality will undertake an assessment of the market before triggering of options to extend the framework agreement. This will be with a view to possible competitive tendering. The agreement applies for Asker and Hurum up until 1.1.2020 whereupon the agreement applies to the Nye Asker kommune, that makes up Asker, Røyken and Hurum municipalities.

The medicinal dispensers must have a number of necessary functionalities so that the desired gains are achieved. Security must be high in order to avoid and having to supplement with manual processes and corrections after erroneous use.
The municipalities have the following requirements:
— Alarm notification to telephones in accordance with defined alarm call chains.
— The dispenser must be able to be filled with two separate multi dose rolls for flexible refilling.
— The dispenser must provide the opportunity to take multi dose bags during absences.
— The dispenser must be able to notify service recipients through speech, text, sound and light.
— The dispenser must have battery back-up for power cuts.
— The dispenser must be able to read the date for medication, directly from the multi dose bags.
— The dispenser must be able to control that the correct multi-dose roll is in the machine.
— The dispenser shall have a lockable container for medicines not taken.
— The system shall notify the service in connection with power failure or if the power cable is disconnected.
— The system shall have technical monitoring and support, with an option for remote control by the tenderer in the event of an error.
— The system shall have personal login features fin order to log who has made changes.
— Alarm warnings if the dispenser is exposed to damage or attempted break-ins.
— The system shall have a log function.
— A platform for administering the multi-dose dispenser that generates reports on compliance.
— The platform shall have secure login.
— The system shall have a screen that can be used as a communication platform between operators in home based services and the user.
— Tenderers must present a development for plan for integration/dialogue with the municipality’s electronic medical record system (EPJ).
— The system shall be established and trialled in several municipalities with documented benefit.

The municipalities want to use this to inform the market and hereby give a ten day period of notice before the contracting authority is able to enter into a contract for the above. The deadline runs from the notice date in Doffin.

The municipality ask suppliers who believe that there is no basis to make the procurement without following the ordinary announcement rules in the procurement regulations to make contact by the stated deadline.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Contracting authority controlled triggering of any option on 1 year + 1 year.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: The municipalities have examined the market for medicinal dispensers. Our conclusion so far is that it is only Evondos that can fulfil the requirements we have for medicinal dispensers for the service recipients in question.
